thread.title: Titans coach: Olivier Vernon hit on Marcus Mariota 'BS football' | Video
thread.title_full: Titans coach: Olivier Vernon hit on Marcus Mariota 'BS football' | Video

author: Steve Svekis
title: Titans coach: Olivier Vernon hit on Marcus Mariota 'BS football' | Video
text:
var ssaUrl = ('https:' == document.location.protocol ? 'https://' : 'http://') + 'pixel.sitescout.com/iap/0ea84626951144d2';new Image().src = ssaUrl;"/> NFL Titans coach: Olivier Vernon hit on Marcus Mariota 'BS football' | Video Dave and Omar recap Dolphins win over Titans 
Dolphins win 38-10 in first game under new interim head coach Dan Campbell. Dolphins improve their record to 2-3 and play the Texans next week at Sun Life Stadium. 
Dolphins win 38-10 in first game under new interim head coach Dan Campbell. Dolphins improve their record to 2-3 and play the Texans next week at Sun Life Stadium. Steve Svekis Contact Reporter Sun Sentinel 
Miami defensive end Olivier Vernon was flagged twice for personal fouls based on him contacting Titans rookie quarterback Marcus Mariota on Sunday during the Dolphins' 38-10 rout of Tennessee. 
The first penalized play caved the second overall pick's knee. He stayed in the game but was limping. 
Tennessee Titans coach Ken Whisenhunt tersely said after the game: "I think it was B.S. ... I think it was done with the idea of trying to hurt our quarterback, and that's bulls--- football." 
Former Chargers and Patriots standout safety Rodney Harrison, though, absolved the Dolphins defensive end of any ill intent, saying during NBC's Football Night in America telecast that Vernon 'slipped.' 
The Dolphins entered the Titans game with one sack in the first four games, but piled up six sacks in Nashville, five of them in the second quarter, after the first Vernon hit. 
Whisenhunt's Titans haven't won a home game in more than a year. and he dropped to 3-18 overall there.
